snippet: The Iowa caucus, despite its position at the center of the political universe every four years, does not legally determine who gets the state's 25 delegates to the Republican nominating convention.
abstract: The Iowa caucus, despite its position at the center of the political universe every four years, does not legally determine who gets the state's 25 delegates to the Republican nominating convention.
lead_paragraph: DES MOINES -- It was, perhaps, the closest finish ever between two candidates in a presidential caucus.

headline.main: Despite Close Finish, No Recount in Iowa
